title: Ticket #4611: Resource request count metrics
description:
We noticed today on the CMS / HTCondor phone call that we have been using auto-clusters as a proxy for negotiating times.

However, this is not necessarily true - we really need a count of the resource request clusters; that's what is sent to the negotiator. There may be several of these per auto-cluster.

To some extent, we are running blind - we have no clue how many RRC's there are per auto-cluster. We'd like to get the statistic reported before we ask for any changes in the negotiation algorithm.
remarks:
2015-Mar-19 15:53:30 by tannenba:
We are going to start with a statistic of ResourceRequestsSent, which will be a schedd statistic of the total number (since schedd start) and the recent number (aka past 20 minutes) of resource requests sent to the negotiator.

Future steps could be to publish statistics about the number of resource requests embodied by all the jobs in the queue, and/or to perhaps break the statistics down per user.
